[H1]Stability[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]The stability system from Rhye's and Fall has been completely replaced in Dawn of Civilization, which features a completely redesigned stability mechanic. The main principles of the new system are that no permanent stability score is stored. Instead every civilization has a stability level, ranging from the familiar Collapsing to Solid. This level can change during a stability check, which can be triggered by a number of events. During the check a stability score is calculated based on a great variety of factors. Depending on the score, the stability level can either remain constant, increase or drop. A stability drop can also cause a crisis. Crises can have different negative effects on your empire. The type of the effects depends on the category in which your stability scored the lowest, while the severity of the crisis is determined by your stability level. A crisis on Collapsing leads to a complete collapse and the elimination of a civilization. After a stability check is over, the calculated score will be discarded. This new system that does not rely on persistent scores and only calculates them during stability checks significantly improves the performance of the stability mechanic and also results in more intuitive outcomes because only the current situation in your civilization matters.[H2]Stability Levels[\H2]Stability levels represent the overall stability of your empire. Stability levels are persistent and should not be confused with the stability score which is calculated on stability checks according to the rules described below, and then discarded. There are five stability levels from best to worst:[ICON_BULLET]Solid[ICON_BULLET]Stable[ICON_BULLET]Shaky[ICON_BULLET]Unstable[ICON_BULLET]CollapsingYour stability level can change during a stability check. They also influence what happens when a stability check has a negative outcome.[H2]Stability Checks[\H2]A stability check is when your stability "matters". They don't happen periodically, but instead are triggered by a number of events:[ICON_BULLET]losing a city[ICON_BULLET]razing a city (human only)[ICON_BULLET]discovering a technology[ICON_BULLET]becoming a vassal[ICON_BULLET]acquiring a vassal (+)[ICON_BULLET]starting a war[ICON_BULLET]making peace (+)[ICON_BULLET]changing civics or state religion[ICON_BULLET]moving your capital[ICON_BULLET]building a wonder (+)[ICON_BULLET]starting a golden age (+)[ICON_BULLET]receiving a great person (+)[NEWLINE]Events marked with a (+) trigger positive stability checks. These checks cannot have negative consequences, which will be explained in more detail below.[NEWLINE]During a check, your stability score is calculated according to the rules described in the previous post. This score is compared to the stability threshold. Based on this comparison, the stability check can have three possible outcomes:[NEWLINE][BOLD]Positive:[\BOLD] The stability score exceeds the threshold by more than 10 points[BOLD]Neutral:[\BOLD] The stability score is equal to or greater than the threshold (but by not more than 10 points)[BOLD]Negative:[\BOLD] The stability score is less than the threshold[NEWLINE]The threshold itself depends on your situation. In particular, it depends on the current stability level:[ICON_BULLET]on solid: +20[ICON_BULLET]on unstable: +10[ICON_BULLET]on shaky: 0[ICON_BULLET]on unstable: -10[ICON_BULLET]on collapsing: -20[NEWLINE]The varying threshold has the purpose of making sure that a civilization does not "fall through the levels" with a constant stability score in subsequent checks. So unless their score changes, every civilization will eventually arrive at a stability level that reflects it.[NEWLINE]The threshold is also lower later in the game to improve overall stability, and during golden ages to allow stability gains in these periods. The average stability of all other civilizations also influences the threshold to avoid a world of only unstable or only stable civs.[NEWLINE]The consequences of a stability check are as follows:[BOLD]Positive:[\BOLD] The stability level increases by one.[BOLD]Neutral:[\BOLD] Nothing happens.[BOLD]Negative:[\BOLD] The stability level decreases by one. If the previous stability level was shaky or lower, a crisis occurs. Civilizations on solid or stable cannot trigger crises.[NEWLINE]During a positive stability check (labeled with a (+) above), negative stability checks have no consequences.[NEWLINE]Human players receive an additional warning for negative outcomes of stability checks. In practice that means that they are immune against the first negative outcome of a stability check, and only subsequent negative outcomes will take effect. Instead, a warning will be displayed in the main event log.[NEWLINE]Civilizations that experience a crisis are also immune against stability checks of any kind for the next ten turns.[H2]Crises[\H2] A negative outcome of a stability check can trigger a crisis. The type of crisis depends on two factors: your [BOLD]stability level[\BOLD] and the stability category with the lowest value (the [BOLD]crisis type[\BOLD]).[NEWLINE]Negative outcomes on solid or stable don't trigger a crisis.[NEWLINE]A crisis on collapsing is also called a [BOLD]terminal crisis[\BOLD] and always leads to a complete collapse of the civilization, regardless of crisis type. AI civilizations are immune to collapses triggered by stability checks from declarations of war by the human player.[NEWLINE] Crises on shaky are [BOLD]moderate crises[\BOLD], while crises on unstable are [BOLD]severe crises[\BOLD]. Their effects depend on the crisis type, i.e. there are:[ICON_BULLET]territorial crises (expansion)[ICON_BULLET]economic crises (economy)[ICON_BULLET]domestic crises (domestic)[ICON_BULLET]diplomatic crises (foreign)[ICON_BULLET]military crises (military)[NEWLINE][BOLD]Territorial Crisis:[\BOLD]Moderate: a single city secedes from your empire. It is chosen according to your stability map, so if available it will be a city on ahistorical territory.Severe: "Collapse to core": if more than half of all non-core cities are ahistorical, all ahistorical cities will secede. Otherwise, all non-core cities will secede.[NEWLINE][BOLD]Economic Crisis:[\BOLD]Moderate: You lose gold equivalent to 50% of your research progress (sum of all techs which you have begun to research). If you do not have enough gold on treasury, the beakers invested in the techs will be subtracted directly.Severe: You lose gold equivalent to 100% of your research progress (see above). All your cottages downgrade one level. You lose all GP points in all cities.[NEWLINE][BOLD]Domestic Crisis:[\BOLD]Moderate: All unhappy cities will go into two turns of unrest.Severe: Two turns of anarchy. All unhappy cities secede.[NEWLINE][BOLD]Diplomatic Crisis[\BOLD]Moderate: Your relations with 2 civilizations will deteriorate.Severe: Your relations with 5 civilizations will deteriorate. All your vassals are set free.[NEWLINE][BOLD]Military Crisis[\BOLD]Moderate: The defense value of all cities with enemy claim is reduced to 0.Severe: Two turns of unrest in all cities with enemy claim. You cannot move all military units for one turn.

[H1]Tile Stability Display[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]In Dawn of Civilization, the stability effect of a specific tile is displayed in the tooltip when you hover over it on the map. The stability categories of tiles are Core (dark green), Historical (light green), Contested (yellow), Foreign (orange) and Foreign Core (red). The colors associated with the categories match those of the stability maps released for RFC.[PARAGRAPH:2]The stability category of a tile influences your expansion stability in multiple ways, depending on the circumstances.[NEWLINE][BOLD]Core Area:[\BOLD][ICON_BULLET]Cities in your core area contribute to your core population score[ICON_BULLET]You can collapse if you're completely pushed out of your core area[ICON_BULLET]You only need 20% culture to maintain control over a tile in your core[NEWLINE][BOLD]Historical Area:[\BOLD][ICON_BULLET]No stability penalties for controlling cities[NEWLINE][BOLD]Contested Area:[\BOLD][ICON_BULLET]No stability penalties for controlling cities[ICON_BULLET]Risk of respawn of another civilization[ICON_BULLET]The civilization native to this area only needs 20% culture to maintain control over this tile[ICON_BULLET]It is harder to build up culture here, which can lead to stability penalties[NEWLINE][BOLD]Foreign Area:[\BOLD][ICON_BULLET]Controlling cities here can hurt your expansion stability[NEWLINE][BOLD]Foreign Core Area:[\BOLD][ICON_BULLET]Controlling cities here can hurt your expansion stability[ICON_BULLET]Risk of respawn of another civilization[ICON_BULLET]The civilization native to this area only needs 20% culture to maintain control over this tile[ICON_BULLET]It is harder to build up culture here, which can lead to stability penalties

[H1]Trading Companies[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]If you are either Portugal, Spain, France, England or the Netherlands, building the Trading Company triggers an event that gives you the opportunity to expand your colonial empire into South Asia. The event selects a number of target cities and gives you the choice to either attempt to acquire them by investing money or raising an army. In case of the former, the owning civ can decline your gold offer, which means the gold is lost. In case of the latter, you lose population and happiness in your capital (similar to drafting), armies appear close to the target cities and you enter war with their owners. If the target areas are empty, you get a settler there instead. AI civilizations get the same opportunity by discovering Astronomy and Gunpowder (Portugal and Spain) or Economics and Rifling (France, England and Netherlands), without building a Trading Company.[NEWLINE]The target areas of each civilization are as follows:[BOLD]Portugal:[\BOLD] three (five for the AI) cities out of Sao Salvador, Quelimane, Muscat, Goa, Cochin, Malacca and Canton[BOLD]Spain:[\BOLD] always Manila[BOLD]France:[\BOLD] one city in South India[BOLD]England:[\BOLD] three cities in India[BOLD]Netherlands:[\BOLD] three cities in Indonesia

[H1]Unique Powers and Historical Victories[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]There are no leader traits in Rhye's and Fall of Civilization. They were removed and replaced with a system of Unique Powers: each civilization has one unique ability according to its historical role. Given the different start years, each civilization have its own modifiers (which rendered leader traits useless). Their effect are summarized in the civ selection screen, at the beginning of the game, with general parameters rated 1 to 5 stars.[PARAGRAPH:2]Each Civilization can achieve a "Historical Victory" fulfilling 3 goals that differ from civ to civ and match their own historical background or just what they were trying to achieve. This way even a civilization with a weaker starting situation such as Aztecs has a chance of success. When 2 goals out of 3 are achieved, a "Triumphal Arch" is automatically built in player's capital, triggering a Golden Age.[PARAGRAPH:2]Dawn of Civilization adds historical victories for religions, which are called Unique Religious Victories (URVs). Civilizations can complete the URV of their state religion, while civilizations without access to a state religion have the opportunity to win by completing the Polytheism (when running Pantheon) or Secularism URV. The Religious Victory also differs from the Historical Victory that all goal conditions have to be fulfilled at the same time to win, and that no reward for completing two goals is available. Also, many goals are global and take the situation of all civilizations with that state religion into account.
TEXT.French: [H1]Victoires historiques et pouvoirs uniques[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Dans Rhye's and Fall of Civilization, les chefs n'ont pas de traits de caractère. Ces derniers ont été supprimés et remplacés par un système de pouvoirs uniques ; chaque civilisation a un pouvoir unique dépendant de son rôle historique. En raison des dates de départ différentes, chaque civilisation bénéficie de ses propres modificateurs, ce qui rendait les traits de caractère inutiles. Les effets de ces modificateurs sont résumés dans l'écran de choix de la civilisation, au début de la partie, avec des paramètres généraux notés de 1 à 5 étoiles.[PARAGRAPH:2]Chaque civilisation peut remporter une "victoire historique" en atteignant trois objectifs, qui sont différents pour chaque civilisation et dépendent de leur histoire ou de ce qu'elles tentaient d'accomplir. De cette façon, même une civilisation désavantagée par sa situation de départ, comme les Aztèques, a une chance de gagner. Quand une civilisation a atteint deux de ses trois objectifs, un "Arc de triomphe" est construit automatiquement dans sa capitale et cela déclenche son âge d'or.
TEXT.German: [H1]Einzigartige Mächte und Historische Siege[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Anders als im Hauptspiel sind den Staatsoberhäuptern in Rhye's and Fall of Civilization keine Eigenschaften zugewiesen. Diese wurden stattdessen durch die so genannten Einzigartigen Mächte ersetzt: Jede Zivilisation besitzt entsprechend ihrer historischen Bedeutung eine einzigartige Fähigkeit. Angesichts der unterschiedlichen Startjahre verfügt jede Zivilisation über eigene Modifikatoren (wodurch sich die Eigenschaften der Staatsoberhäupter erübrigen). Deren Auswirkungen werden zu Beginn des Spiels im Bildschirm für die Zivilisationsauswahl mit einer allgemeinen Parameterwertung von 1 bis 5 Sternen zusammengefasst.[PARAGRAPH:2]Jede Zivilisation kann einen "Historischen Sieg" erringen, indem sie 3 Ziele erreicht, die sich von Nation zu Nation unterscheiden und ihrem jeweiligen historischen Hintergrund oder einfach nur ihren aktuellen Bestrebungen im Spiel entsprechen. Auf diese Weise bleiben auch für eine Zivilisation mit einer schwächeren Ausgangsposition beim Spielstart (z. B. die Azteken) die Erfolgschancen gewahrt. Sobald 2 von 3 Zielen erfüllt sind, wird in der Hauptstadt des betreffenden Spielers automatisch ein "Triumphbogen" errichtet und ein Goldenes Zeitalter ausgelöst.
TEXT.Italian: [H1]Poteri unici e vittorie storiche[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]Non ci sono caratteristiche dei leader, in Rhye's and Fall. Sono state tolte e rimpiazzate con un sistema di poteri unici: ogni civiltà ha un'abilità esclusiva, secondo il proprio ruolo storico. Dati i diversi anni di avvio, ogni civiltà ha i propri modificatori (che rendevano inutili le caratteristiche dei leader). Gli effetti sono riassunti nella schermata di selezione della civiltà, all'inizio del gioco, coi parametri generali indicati con un numero di stelle da 1 a 5.[PARAGRAPH:2]Ogni civiltà può ottenere una "vittoria storica", raggiungendo 3 obiettivi diversi, che variano da civiltà a civiltà e che si rifanno al loro background storico o a quello che stavano cercando di ottenere. In questo modo anche una civiltà con una situazione di partenza più debole, come gli Aztechi, ha probabilità di successo. Quando vengono raggiunti 2 obiettivi su 3 viene costruito automaticamente un "Arco di trionfo" nella capitale del giocatore, avviando un'età dell'oro.
TEXT.Spanish: [H1]Poderes únicos y victorias históricas[\H1][PARAGRAPH:2]No hay rasgos de los líderes en Rhye's and Fall of Civilization. Éstos han sido eliminados y sustituidos por un sistema de poderes únicos: todas las civilizaciones tienen una habilidad única relacionada con su papel en la historia. Como las fechas de inicio son diferentes, cada civilización tiene sus propios modificadores (por lo que los rasgos de los líderes son inútiles). Su efecto se resume en la pantalla de selección de la civilización, al comienzo de la partida, con unos parámetros generales que van de 1 a 5 estrellas.[PARAGRAPH:2]Todas las civilizaciones pueden conseguir una "victoria histórica" si cumplen tres objetivos diferentes en función de la civilización de la que se trate; objetivos que concuerdan con su trasfondo histórico o que simplemente intentaban lograr. De este modo, hasta las civilizaciones con peores situaciones de inicio, como la Azteca, pueden lograr el éxito. Cuando se cumplen 2 de los 3 objetivos, automáticamente se construye un "Arco de Triunfo" en la capital del jugador y se inicia una edad de oro.

TEXT.English: [TAB]While most food processing corporations are less than 150 years old, food processing is an ancient tradition. The miller was the original food processing entrepreneur, turning inedible wheat into versatile flour, all while pulling in a tidy profit. Understandably, many modern food processing companies rose from the milling industry, often picking up a few new subsidiaries along the way. Today's food processors deal in a diverse range of consumer products, lining the walls of the local supermarket with everything from mayonnaise to deodorant.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Alors que la plupart des sociétés de l'industrie alimentaire ont moins de 150 ans, la préparation des aliments est une vieille tradition. Le moulin fut la première entreprise de préparation des aliments, transformant le blé non comestible en farine polyvalente tout en suscitant un profit non négligeable. Naturellement, beaucoup de moulins se sont transformés en sociétés agroalimentaires, qui elles-mêmes ont créé de nombreuses filiales. L'industrie alimentaire moderne a une production très variée, inondant les supermarchés avec un grand nombre de produits allant de la mayonnaise au déodorant.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Obwohl es die meisten Lebensmittelhersteller seit weniger als 150 Jahren gibt, ist die Lebensmittelherstellung eine uralte Tradition. Der Müller ist der ursprünglichste Lebensmittelunternehmer, der unverwertbaren Weizen zu vielseitigem Mehl verarbeitet und dabei noch ordentlichen Gewinn macht. Verständlicherweise entwickelten sich aus dem Gewerbe des Müllers zahlreiche Unternehmen der Lebensmittelverarbeitung, die auf dem Weg an die Spitze häufig ein paar neue Tochterfirmen erwarben. Heutzutage handeln Lebensmittelhersteller mit einer großen Palette an Konsumgütern und alle möglichen Produkte zieren die Wände der Supermärkte: von Mayonnaise bis hin zum Deodorant.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Mentre la maggior parte delle società di lavorazione del cibo non ha più di 150 anni, l'attività ha una lunga tradizione. Il mugnaio fu uno dei primi lavoratori di cibo, perché trasformava l'immangiabile grano in versatile farina, realizzando anche un profitto. Chiaramente molte compagnie per la lavorazione del cibo sono nate dall'industria della macinatura, spesso acquistando qualche sussidiaria lungo il cammino. I produttori odierni di cibo hanno a che fare con diversi prodotti per i consumatori e riempiono gli scaffali dei supermercati con tutto, dalla maionese ai deodoranti.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Aunque la mayoría de las grandes empresas dedicadas a ello tienen menos de 150 años, el procesado de alimentos es una tradición muy antigua. El molino, una máquina que transformaba el trigo en harina (y proporcionaba al mismo tiempo un interesante margen de beneficios) fue la primera procesadora de alimentos. Esto explica que muchas de las compañías modernas procedan de la industria de la molienda (que en muchas ocasiones han ido absorbiendo subsidiarias a lo largo de este proceso). Las procesadoras de alimentos de nuestros días trabajan gran variedad de productos y llenan los estantes de los supermercados de todo tipo de bienes, desde mayonesa a desodorante.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Computer Industry, or information technology (IT) industry, is the range of businesses involved in developing computer software, designing computer hardware and computer networking infrastructures, the manufacture of computer components and the provision of information technology (IT) services.

[TAB]The fishing industry includes any industry or activity concerned with taking, culturing, processing, preserving, storing, transporting, marketing or selling fish or fish products. It is defined by the Food and Agriculture Organization as including recreational, subsistence and commercial fishing, and the harvesting, processing, and marketing sectors. The commercial activity is aimed at the delivery of fish and other seafood products for human consumption or as input factors in other industrial processes. Directly or indirectly, the livelihood of over 500 million people in developing countries depends on fisheries and aquaculture.

[TAB]Humanity's fascination with shiny objects has persisted since time immemorial. Gold, silver and jewels have decorated the heads of monarchs and the interiors of palaces for millennia, but it was the nineteenth century that began the true blossoming of the trade in treasures. Gold rushes throughout the world - in the United States, Canada and Australia - not only created new fonts of wealth, but left a lasting impression on the shape of world population, relocating avaricious prospectors to some of the most remote places on earth.[PARAGRAPH:1]The gem trade, with diamonds as its crown, grew up around similar circumstances. Throngs of miners flocked to South Africa in the mid-nineteenth century with the discovery of the "Star of Africa," an enormous 83.5 carat diamond. As of the turn of the twentieth century, the age of the traveling prospector bowed before the growth of enormous precious metal and jewel firms. South Africa remains one of the most important sources for gold and diamonds in the world, as well as the birth place to some of the most influential corporations in the business.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La fascination de l'humanité pour les objets brillants s'exerce depuis des temps immémoriaux. L'or, l'argent et les pierres précieuses ornent les têtes des monarques et l'intérieur des palais depuis des millénaires, mais c'est le dix-neuvième siècle qui inaugure le véritable apogée des échanges d'objets précieux. Les ruées vers l'or qui eurent lieu aux Etats-Unis, au Canada et en Australie créent de nouvelles sources de richesse, mais transforment également la physionomie de la population mondiale, alors que des milliers de cupides prospecteurs partent s'installer dans les lieux les plus reculés de la Terre.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le commerce de pierres précieuses, dominé par celui des diamants, se développe dans des circonstances semblables. Au milieu du dix-neuvième siècle, une foule de mineurs affluent en Afrique du Sud après la découverte du "Cullinan", un énorme diamant de 3 106,75 carats. Puis, au début du vingtième siècle, l'ère du chercheur d'or prend fin et laisse la place à d'énormes firmes spécialisées dans le commerce des pierres et métaux précieux. L'Afrique du Sud demeure l'une des sources d'or et de diamants les plus importantes au monde et a vu naître les sociétés commerciales les plus influentes de ce métier.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Faszination für glänzende Gegenstände existiert schon seit Menschengedenken. Gold, Silber und Edelsteine zieren die Köpfe der Könige und das Innere ihrer Paläste schon seit tausenden von Jahren, aber erst im 19. Jahrhundert blühte der Handel mit den edlen Schätzen richtig auf. Goldräusche auf der ganzen Welt - in den USA, Kanada und Australien - haben nicht nur neue Quellen für Reichtum geschaffen, sondern auch die Verteilung der Weltbevölkerung dauerhaft geprägt - habgierige Goldgräber siedelten sich in den abgelegensten Gegenden der Erde an.[PARAGRAPH:1]Der Handel mit Edelsteinen, allen voran Diamanten, entwickelte sich unter ähnlichen Umständen. Mit dem Fund des "Cullinan" - einem riesigen Diamanten von 3106,75 Karat - strömten Bergarbeiter Mitte des 19. Jahrhunderts in Scharen nach Südafrika. Um die Jahrhundertwende endete das Zeitalter der reisenden Goldgräber und machte Platz für das Wachstum riesiger Wertmetall- und Edelsteinunternehmen. Südafrika verfügt weiterhin über die größten Gold- und Diamantenvorkommen der Welt und ist die Geburtsstätte einiger der einflussreichsten Unternehmen der Branche.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'umanità è affascinata da tempo immemore dagli oggetti che luccicano. Oro, argento e gioielli hanno decorato le teste di monarchi e gli interni dei palazzi per millenni, ma fu nel diciannovesimo secolo che iniziò a fiorire il commercio di tesori. Le corse all'oro in tutto il mondo (Stati Uniti, Canada e Australia) non solo crearono nuove fonti di ricchezza, ma lasciarono un'impronta duratura sulla distribuzione della popolazione mondiale, con avidi prospettori che si recarono nelle più remote regioni della Terra.[PARAGRAPH:1]Il commercio delle gemme, tra cui spiccano i diamanti, si sviluppò in circostanze simili. Dopo la scoperta del "Cullinan", un gigantesco diamante da 3.106,75 carati, orde di minatori si recarono in Sud Africa a metà del diciannovesimo secolo. All'inizio del ventesimo secolo, l'era del prospettore itinerante si fece da parte davanti alla crescita di enormi compagnie che trattavano metalli preziosi e gemme. Il Sud Africa rimane una delle fonti più importanti al mondo d'oro e di diamanti, così come il luogo in cui nacquero alcune delle più importanti corporazioni del settore.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La fascinación del hombre por los objetos brillantes existe desde tiempo inmemorial. El oro, la plata y las joyas han engalanado las cabezas de los monarcas y el interior de los templos desde hace milenios, pero fue en el siglo XIX cuando floreció de verdad el comercio de estos tesoros. La fiebre del oro por todo el mundo (en los Estados Unidos, Canadá y Australia), además de crear nuevas fuentes de riqueza, dejó una huella imperecedera en la conformación demográfica del mundo, provocando el traslado de avariciosos prospectores a algunos de los lugares más remotos del planeta.[PARAGRAPH:1]El comercio de piedras preciosas (cuyo monarca era el diamante) creció en circunstancias parecidas. En el siglo XIX, con el descubrimiento del "Cullinan", un enorme diamante de 3106.75 quilates, miles de mineros acudieron en tropel a las tierras de Sudáfrica. Con el cambio de siglo, la era del prospector solitario dejó paso a inmensas compañías extractoras de metales preciosos y producción de joyería. Sudáfrica sigue siendo uno de los principales productores de oro y diamantes del mundo, y sudafricanas son algunas de las empresas más importantes de la industria.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Oil Industry includes the global processes of exploration, extraction, refining, transporting (often by oil tankers and pipelines), and marketing oil products. The largest volume products of the industry are fuel oil and gasoline (petrol). oil is also the raw material for many chemical products, including pharmaceuticals, solvents, fertilizers, pesticides, and plastics. The industry is usually divided into three major components: upstream, midstream and downstream. Midstream operations are usually included in the downstream category.[PARAGRAPH:1]Oil is vital to many industries, and is of importance to the maintenance of industrial civilization in its current configuration, and thus is a critical concern for many nations. Oil accounts for a large percentage of the world's energy consumption, ranging from a low of 32% for Europe and Asia, to a high of 53% for the Middle East.[PARAGRAPH:1]Other geographic regions' consumption patterns are as follows: South and Central America (44%), Africa (41%), and North America (40%). The world consumes 30 billion barrels (4.8 km³) of oil per year, with developed nations being the largest consumers. The United States consumed 25% of the oil produced in 2007. The production, distribution, refining, and retailing of oil taken as a whole represents the world's largest industry in terms of dollar value.[PARAGRAPH:1]Governments such as the United States government provide a heavy public subsidy to oil companies, with major tax breaks at virtually every stage of oil exploration and extraction, including the costs of oil field leases and drilling equipment.

[TAB]The Silk Road or Silk Routes refer to a network of interlinking trade routes across the Afro-Eurasian landmass that connected East, South, and Western Asia with the Mediterranean and European world, as well as parts of North and East Africa. The land routes were supplemented by sea routes which extended from the Red Sea to East Africa, India, China, and Southeast Asia. China traded silk, spices, teas, and porcelain; while India traded ivory, textiles, precious stones, and pepper; and the Roman Empire exported gold, silver, fine glassware, wine, carpets, and jewels.[PARAGRAPH:1]In recent years, both the maritime and overland Silk Routes are again being used, often closely following the ancient routes.[PARAGRAPH:1]Going back nearly 2000 years, during China's Eastern Han Dynasty, a sea route, although not part of the formal Silk Route, led from the mouth of the Red River near modern Hanoi, through the Malacca Straits to Southeast Asia, Sri Lanka and India, and then on to the Persian Gulf and the Red Sea kingdom of Axum and eventually to Roman ports. From ports on the Red Sea, goods, including silks, were transported overland to the Nile and then to Alexandria from where they were shipped to Rome, Constantinople and other Mediterranean ports.[PARAGRAPH:1]Another branch of these sea routes led down the East African coast, called "Azania " by the Greeks and Romans in the 1st century AD, as described in the Periplus of the Erythraean Sea (and, very probably, Zesan in the 3rd century by the Chinese), at least as far as the port known to the Romans as "Rhapta," which was probably located in the delta of the Rufiji River in modern Tanzania.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Silk Road extends from Guangzhou, located in southern China, to present day Brunei, Myanmar (Burma), Thailand, Malacca, Ceylon, India, Pakistan, the Philippines, Iran and Iraq. In Europe it extends from Israel, Lebanon (Collectively, the Levant), Egypt, and Italy (historically, Venice) in the Mediterranean Sea to other European ports or caravan routes such as the great Hanseatic League fairs via the Spanish road and other Alpine routes. This water route is called in some sources "the Indian Ocean Maritime System".

[TAB]For much of human history, victory has gone to those with access to the finest metals. From the Bronze Age onwards, metal tools, weapons and alloys have been an inherent part of the rise of civilization, spurring conquests and construction by the world's greatest empires. And while metal mining has had an impressive history, it was not until the nineteenth century that industrial mining truly began to take root.[PARAGRAPH:1]Two reasons explain this sudden intensification in mining operations. The first was the almost daily revolutions in the production of tools and consumer items, requiring a continual source of metal to produce them. The second was that the fuel that powered the Industrial Revolution was coal, nestled deep within the earth. In modern times, enormous excavators like the Bagger 288 have it possible to mine a pit three-hundred feet long and one-hundred feet deep in a day, a feat that, in the past, would have required the mobilization of nations.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Pendant la majeure partie de l'histoire, la victoire est revenue à ceux qui avaient accès aux métaux les plus précieux. Depuis l'âge du bronze, les outils en métal, les armes et les alliages font partie intégrante de l'essor de la civilisation et poussent les plus grands empires à conquérir de nouveaux territoires et à bâtir de nouveaux édifices. L'extraction du métal existe depuis bien longtemps mais ce n'est qu'au 19ème siècle que l'extraction industrielle a réellement pris son envol.[PARAGRAPH:1]Deux raisons expliquent cette soudaine intensification. Tout d'abord, les innovations quasi-quotidiennes dans la production d'outils et de biens de consommation nécessitent un approvisionnement continu en métal. D'autre part, la révolution industrielle s'est énormément appuyée sur le charbon, lequel était niché au plus profond de la terre. De nos jours, d'énormes pelleteuses comme le Bagger 288 permettent de creuser un trou de quatre-vingt dix mètres de long et trente mètres de profondeur en une journée, exploit qui dans le passé aurait nécessité la mobilisation de nations entières.
TEXT.German: [TAB]In der Geschichte der Menschheit trugen meist diejenigen den Sieg davon, die über die besten Metalle verfügten. Seit dem Bronzezeitalter waren Metallwerkzeuge, Waffen und Legierungen ein grundlegender Faktor für den Aufstieg der Zivilisation und haben Eroberungen und das Bauwesen der weltweit größten Imperien vorangetrieben. Während der Metallabbau schon eine eindrucksvolle Geschichte hinter sich hat, gewann der industrielle Bergbau erst im 19. Jahrhundert an Bedeutung.[PARAGRAPH:1]Für den plötzlichen Aufschwung des Bergbaus gibt es zwei Gründe. Der erste Grund waren die fast alltäglichen Neuerungen in der Produktion von Werkzeugen und Konsumgegenständen, für die der unaufhörliche Nachschub an Metall erforderlich war. Der zweite Grund lag darin, dass der Treibstoff für die industrielle Revolution die Kohle war, die nur tief in der Erde vorkam. Heutzutage ermöglichen es riesige Abbaumaschinen wie der Schaufelradbagger, in nur einem Tag ein 90 Meter langes und 30 Meter tiefes Loch zu graben - eine Meisterleistung, zu der früher nur ganze Nationen mit vereinten Kräften in der Lage gewesen wären.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Per gran parte della storia dell'umanità la vittoria è andata a coloro che avevano accesso ai metalli migliori. Dall'età del Bronzo in poi, strumenti e armi in metallo e lega sono stati parte importante dell'ascesa di una civiltà, favorendo le conquiste e la creazione dei più grandi imperi al mondo. E mentre l'estrazione dei metalli ha una lunga e grande storia, fu solo nel diciannovesimo secolo che cominciò a prendere piede l'estrazione industriale.[PARAGRAPH:1]Due ragioni spiegano l'improvvisa intensificazione delle operazioni minerarie. La prima è la rivoluzione quasi quotidiana nella produzione di strumenti e oggetti di consumo, che richiedeva un costante afflusso di metallo. La seconda è che il carburante della Rivoluzione Industriale era il carbone, annidato nelle profondità della terra. Al giorno d'oggi enormi escavatrici come la Bagger 288 permettono di scavare un buco lungo cento metri e profondo 30 in un solo giorno; un'impresa che, in passato, avrebbe richiesto la mobilitazione di un'intera nazione.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Durante buena parte de la historia del hombre, la victoria ha sido para el bando que tenía acceso a los mejores metales. Desde la Edad de Bronce en adelante, las herramientas, armas y aleaciones de metal han sido una parte inherente del ascenso de las civilizaciones y han permitido grandes conquistas y la construcción de enormes imperios. Y, aunque la minería del metal tiene una historia muy antigua, hasta el siglo XIX no empezó a desarrollarse industrialmente.[PARAGRAPH:1]Dos razones explican esta repentina intensificación de las operaciones mineras. La primera fue una revolución casi diaria en la producción de bienes de consumo y herramientas, que requería un suministro continuo de metal. La segunda fue que el combustible que alimentaba la Revolución Industrial era el carbón, profundamente enterrado en las entrañas de la Tierra. En nuestros días, las grandes excavadoras, como la Bagger 288, poseen la capacidad de excavar fosos de cien metros de longitud y treinta metros de profundidad en un solo día, una proeza que en el pasado habría requerido la movilización de naciones enteras.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Textile Industry or apparel industry is primarily concerned with the production of yarn, and cloth and the subsequent design or manufacture of clothing and their distribution. The raw material may be natural, or synthetic using products of the chemical industry. The textile industry grew out of the industrial revolution in the 18th Century as mass production of yarn and cloth became a mainstream industry.[PARAGRAPH:1]In 1734 in Bury, Lancashire, John Kay invented the flying shuttle - one of the first of a series of inventions associated with the cotton industry. The flying shuttle increased the width of cotton cloth and speed of production of a single weaver at a loom. Resistance by workers to the perceived threat to jobs delayed the widespread introduction of this technology, even though the higher rate of production generated an increased demand for spun cotton.[PARAGRAPH:1]In 1761, the Duke of Bridgewater's canal connected Manchester to the coal fields of Worsley and in 1762, Matthew Boulton opened the Soho Foundry engineering works in Handsworth, Birmingham. His partnership with Scottish engineer James Watt resulted, in 1775, in the commercial production of the more efficient Watt steam engine which used a separate condensor.[PARAGRAPH:1]In 1764, James Hargreaves is credited as inventor of the spinning jenny which multiplied the spun thread production capacity of a single worker - initially eightfold and subsequently much further. Others credit the original invention to Thomas Highs. Industrial unrest and a failure to patent the invention until 1770 forced Hargreaves from Blackburn, but his lack of protection of the idea allowed the concept to be exploited by others. As a result, there were over 20,000 Spinning Jennies in use by the time of his death. Again in 1764, Thorp Mill, the first water-powered cotton mill in the world was constructed at Royton, Lancashire, England. It was used for carding cotton. With the spinning and weaving process now mechanized, cotton mills cropped up all over the North West of England.

[TAB]A trading company is an association formed by investors or shareholders for the purpose of trade, exploration and colonisation. Typically, these companies were formed from the sixteenth century onwards by groups of European investors to underwrite and profit from the exploration of Africa, India, the Caribbean and North America, usually under the patronage of one state, which issued the company's charter. Notable companies include British East India Company and Dutch Verenigde Oostindische Compagnie.

[TAB]Clams are shelled marine or freshwater molluscs that live up to 150 years old. They can be eaten raw, steamed, boiled, baked or fried. In the shallow coral reefs of the South Pacific and Indian oceans, giant clams, traditionally called pa'ua, can grow to a weight of 440 pounds and measure as much as 1.5 meters across. These giant clams are the largest living bivalve mulluscs.[PARAGRAPH:1]Historically, the giant clam was also known as killer clam or man-eating clam and reputed to cause deaths. Today, it is generally acknowledged that the giant clam is neither aggressive nor particularly dangerous.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les coquillages sont des mollusques marins ou d'eau douce à coquille, dont la durée de vie peut atteindre 150 ans. On les mange crus, bouillis, frits, cuits à la vapeur ou au four. Dans les récifs coralliens peu profonds de l'océan Pacifique sud et de l'océan Indien, on trouve des coquillages géants, appelés traditionnellement bénitiers, qui peuvent peser jusqu'à 225 kg et mesurer 1,5 m de diamètre. Ces coquillages géants sont les plus grands mollusques bivalves.[PARAGRAPH:1]La légende veut que le bénitier soit un tueur, un mangeur d'hommes. Mais on sait aujourd'hui qu'il n'est ni agressif, ni même particulièrement dangereux.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Muscheln sind schalenbewehrte Weichtiere, die bis zu 150 Jahre alt werden. Sie können roh, gekocht, gebacken oder frittiert verzehrt werden. Auf den flachen Korallenriffen des Südpazifiks und des Indischen Ozeans wachsen Riesenmuscheln. Diese "Pa'ua" erreichen ein Gewicht von bis zu 200 Kilogramm und werden bis zu 1,5 Meter groß. Diese Riesenmuscheln sind die größten lebenden zweischaligen Muscheln.[PARAGRAPH:1]Früher galt die Riesenmuschel als Menschenfresser und wurde für zahlreiche Todesfälle verantwortlich gemacht. Heute ist erwiesen, dass Riesenmuscheln weder aggressiv noch gefährlich sind.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]I bivalvi sono delle conchiglie marine contenenti dei molluschi che possono vivere fino a 150 anni. Questi possono essere mangiati crudi, stufati, bolliti, cotti o fritti. Nelle barriere coralline del Pacifico del Sud e nell'Oceano Indiano crescono i bivalvi giganti, chiamati tradizionalmente pa'ua, che possono raggiungere il peso di quasi 200 chili e un metro e mezzo di diametro; si possono considerare i più grandi bivalvi esistenti sulla faccia della terra.[PARAGRAPH:1]Storicamente, i bivalvi giganti erano conosciuti anche col nome di conchiglie assassine, poiché si credeva fossero causa della morte di esseri umani. Al giorno d'oggi, siamo assolutamente certi che questo essere vivente non è aggressivo, né tantomeno pericoloso.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La almeja es un molusco con concha que vive en agua dulce o salada y alcanza hasta los ciento cincuenta años de edad. Se puede comer cruda, al vapor, hervida, al horno o frita. En los poco profundos arrecifes de coral del Pacífico sur y el Índico, las almejas gigantes, llamadas tradicionalmente "pa'ua", pueden alcanzar un peso de doscientos kilos y medir hasta metro y medio de lado a lado. Estas almejas gigantes son el mayor molusco bivalvo vivo.[PARAGRAPH:1]Históricamente, a la almeja gigante también se la consideraba la almeja asesina o almeja devorahombres, y se creía que causaba muertes. Hoy se sabe que este molusco no es ni agresivo ni particularmente peligroso.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Copper is a metal that has been used by humanity for over five millennia. Copper is a soft metal and in its natural state unsuited for lengthy use - copper swords and daggers become dull very quickly, for instance. It is attractive, however, and was commonly used for pendants, bracelets and other decorative artifacts. By around 3000 BC, it was discovered that melting a bit of zinc or tin with the copper produced a much harder and more useful product: bronze. Within a short period bronze weapons, armor, and tools were in widespread use, and thus the Bronze Age was born.[PARAGRAPH:1]Interestingly, bronze is actually a tougher metal than iron. The Bronze Age was succeeded by the Iron Age not because iron was a better metal, but because tin and zinc had become scarce.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le cuivre est un métal utilisé par l'homme depuis plus de cinq millénaires. C'est à l'état pur un métal malléable, inadapté pour des usages prolongés. Les épées et les dagues en cuivre, par exemple, s'émoussent très vite. En revanche, il est attrayant et a été fréquemment utilisé pour fabriquer des pendentifs, des bracelets ou autres objets décoratifs. Vers 3000 av. J.-C. l'homme a découvert qu'en faisant fondre un peu de zinc ou d'étain avec du cuivre, il obtenait un métal beaucoup plus dur : le bronze. L'utilisation du bronze pour fabriquer des armes, des armures et des outils s'est très vite répandue, donnant naissance à l'Age de Bronze.[PARAGRAPH:1]Il est intéressant de noter que le bronze est plus résistant que le fer, et que si l'Age de Fer a succédé à l'Age de Bronze, c'est uniquement parce que le zinc et l'étain devenaient rares.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Kupfer wird seit mehr als 5000 Jahren von den Menschen genutzt. Das weiche Metall kann in seinem natürlichen Zustand nur über einen kurzen Zeitraum verwendet werden, da beispielsweise Schwerter und Dolche aus Kupfer sehr schnell stumpf werden. Es sieht jedoch sehr gut aus und wurde im Allgemeinen für Anhänger, Armbänder und andere dekorative Artefakte verwendet. Etwa um 3000 vor Christus erkannte man, dass ein deutlich härteres und nützlicheres Produkt entstand, wenn man Zink oder Zinn gemeinsam mit dem Kupfer schmolz: Bronze. Wenig später waren Bronzewaffen, -rüstungen und -werkzeuge weit verbreitet. Dies war der Beginn des Bronzezeitalters.[PARAGRAPH:1]Interessanterweise ist Bronze härter als Eisen. Das Bronzezeitalter wurde von der Eisenzeit also nicht abgelöst, weil Eisen das bessere Metall war, sondern weil Zinn und Zink selten geworden waren.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il rame è un metallo che è stato utilizzato dall'umanità per oltre cinque millenni. È un metallo morbido e al suo stato naturale è inadatto per impieghi duraturi nel tempo: per esempio, spade e coltelli di rame si rovinano molto rapidamente. Tuttavia è un metallo affascinante ed è stato comunemente utilizzato per la realizzazione di orecchini, bracciali e altri artefatti decorativi. Intorno al 3000 a. C., si è scoperto che fondendo un po' di zinco o stagno si poteva ottenere una lega più resistente: il bronzo. In un breve periodo di tempo, la produzione di armi, armature e oggetti, divenne di uso comune, avviando così l'Età del Bronzo.[PARAGRAPH:1]Sorprendentemente, il bronzo è un metallo decisamente più resistente del ferro. L'Età del Bronzo venne rimpiazzata dall'Età del Ferro non perché quest'ultimo metallo fosse migliore, ma perché le riserve di stagno e zinco stavano iniziando a scarseggiare.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El cobre es un metal que ha sido utilizado por la humanidad desde hace más de cinco milenios. Se trata de un metal blando, y su estado natural no es adecuado para un uso continuado. Por ejemplo, las espadas y dagas de cobre pierden el filo con mucha rapidez. Sin embargo, es atractivo, y se usaba comúnmente en pendientes, brazaletes y otros artículos decorativos. Alrededor del año 3000 a. C., se descubrió que al fundir un poco de zinc con el cobre, se creaba un producto mucho más duro y útil: el bronce. Al poco tiempo, se generalizaba el uso de espadas, armaduras y herramientas de bronce, y así fue como nació la Edad del Bronce.[PARAGRAPH:1]Curiosamente, el bronce es un metal más resistente que el hierro. La Edad del Hierro sucedió a la del bronce no porque el primero fuese un metal mejor, sino porque el estaño y el zinc escaseaban.

TEXT.English: [TAB]These ruminant mammals are widely distributed, with representatives in all continents except Australia and Africa. Deer differ from other ruminants in that they have antlers instead of horns. The male deer are called stags, harts, bucks, or bulls, and females are called does, hinds, or cows. Young deer are often referred to as fawns or calves.[PARAGRAPH:1]It is thought that the New World species evolved about five million years ago in the forests of North America and Siberia.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Ces mammifères ruminants sont très répandus sur tous les continents, à l'exception de l'Océanie et de l'Afrique. Les cervidés se différencient des autres ruminants par les bois qu'ils portent à la place des cornes. Il en existe 44 espèces dans le monde, parmi lesquelles le cerf, le daim, l'orignal, le chevreuil ou encore l'élan.[PARAGRAPH:1]On pense que les espèces du Nouveau Monde vivaient il y a cinq millions d'années dans les forêts d'Amérique du Nord et de Sibérie.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Diese wiederkäuenden Säugetiere sind auf allen Kontinenten (mit Ausnahme Australiens und Afrikas) anzutreffen. Rehe unterscheiden sich von anderen Wiederkäuern durch ihr Geweih. Die männlichen Tiere nennt man Hirsche oder Böcke, die weiblichen Tiere Kühe oder Ricken. Jungtiere sind Kitze oder Kälber.[PARAGRAPH:1]Vermutlich hat sich die Spezies in der Neuen Welt vor etwa fünf Millionen Jahren in den Wäldern Nordamerikas und Sibiriens entwickelt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Questi mammiferi ruminanti sono molto diffusi in tutti i continenti, tranne Australia e Africa. Il cervo differisce dagli altri ruminanti per le sue corna ramificate, anziché quelle appuntite.[PARAGRAPH:1]Si crede che le specie del Nuovo Continente si siano evolute circa cinque milioni di anni fa nelle foreste dell'America del Nord e in Siberia.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Estos mamíferos rumiantes están ampliamente extendidos, con representantes en todos los continentes excepto Australia y África. Se distinguen de otros rumiantes en que tienen astas en vez de cuernos. Entre las variedades de ciervo están el venado, el gamo, el alce y el reno. A los ciervos jóvenes se les suele llamar cervatillos o cervatos.[PARAGRAPH:1]Se cree que las especies del Nuevo Mundo evolucionaron hace unos cinco millones de años en los bosques de Norteamérica y Siberia.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Elephants are the largest living land mammals. At birth it is common for an elephant calf to weigh 225 pounds! In the wild, elephants exhibit complex social behavior and strong family bonds. Social hierarchy in calf-cow groups is based on size and age, with the largest and oldest at the top and the smallest and youngest last. Adolescent males determine their own ranking order through jousting contests using head and tusks. Elephants communicate with very low and long ranging subsonic tones.[PARAGRAPH:1]Elephant taming began in the Indus valley around 4000 years ago. The first military application of elephants dates from around 1100 BC and is mentioned in several Sanskrit hymns. From the east, war elephants migrated to the Persian Empire where they stood against Alexander the Great at the battle of Gaugamela. Though they did not play a significant role in the battle, Alexander saw their usefulness and began incorporating them into his army. Later the use spread throughout Europe and elephants were used in such famous campaigns as the Macedonian wars and by Hannibal during the Second Punic War.
TEXT.French: [TAB]L'éléphant est le plus gros mammifère terrestre. Un éléphanteau pèse à la naissance environ 100 kg ! Dans leur milieu naturel, les éléphants vivent en groupe et ont des comportements sociaux complexes ainsi que des liens familiaux très forts. La hiérarchie sociale est fonction du poids et de l'âge, le plus gros et le plus vieux étant en haut de l'échelle. Les jeunes mâles déterminent entre eux leur position sociale en se livrant à des combats à l'aide de leur tête et de leurs défenses. Les éléphants communiquent entre eux par des infrasons audibles à des kilomètres.[PARAGRAPH:1]L'apprivoisement de l'éléphant a commencé il y a plus de 4 000 ans dans la vallée de l'Indus. La première application militaire de l'éléphant date d'environ 1100 av. J.-C. et est mentionnée dans plusieurs hymnes en sanskrit. Depuis l'Est, les éléphants de guerre migrent vers l'Empire perse et sont utilisés contre Alexandre le Grand lors de la bataille de Gaugamèles. Bien qu'ils n'y aient pas joué un rôle majeur, Alexandre perçoit leur utilité et en incorpore dans son armée. Leur utilisation se répand ensuite à travers l'Europe, et des éléphants intervinrent au cours de célèbres campagnes comme les guerres macédoniennes ou la Deuxième guerre punique (Hannibal).
TEXT.German: [TAB]Elefanten sind die größten Landsäugetiere der Welt. Ein Elefantenkalb wiegt bereits bei seiner Geburt etwa 100 kg! In der Wildnis entwickeln Elefanten ein komplexes Sozialverhalten und starke Familienbindungen. Die soziale Hierarchie basiert auf Kuh-Kalb-Gemeinschaften bzw. der Größe und dem Alter der einzelnen Tiere einer Herde. Ausgewachsene Elefantenbullen erlangen ihren Rang durch Kämpfe mit Kopf und Stoßzähnen. Elefanten kommunizieren mit sehr leisen und weit reichenden Infraschalltönen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Die ersten Elefanten wurden vor etwa 4000 Jahren im Industal gezähmt. Um 1100 vor Christus wurden sie laut verschiedener Sanskritschriften erstmals für militärische Zwecke eingesetzt. Von Osten zogen die Kriegselefanten in das Perserreich, um dort in der Schlacht von Gaugamela gegen Alexander den Großen zu kämpfen. Obwohl sie bei dieser Schlacht keine bedeutende Rolle spielten, erkannte Alexander ihren Wert und begann, sie in seine Armee zu integrieren. Später kamen Elefanten in ganz Europa zum Einsatz. Sie nahmen an den Mazedonischen Kriegen teil und waren im Zweiten Punischen Krieg eine der wichtigsten Waffen Hanibals.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Gli elefanti sono i mammiferi viventi più grandi del mondo. Appena nato, un piccolo di elefante può pesare fino a 100 Kg! Nella vita allo stato brado, gli elefanti adottano complessi comportamenti sociali e sviluppato forti legami familiari. La gerarchia sociale dei branchi è determinata sulla dimensione e sull'età: i più anziani e grandi in cima, i più piccoli e giovani in fondo. I giovani maschi determinano la loro posizione nella società duellando a colpi di zanne e testate. Gli elefanti comunicano tra loro usando frequenze molto basse.[PARAGRAPH:1]L'addomesticamento degli elefanti cominciò circa 4.000 anni fa nella valle dell'Indo; il primo impiego militare, invece, risale al 1100 a. C. circa, dove gli elefanti vengono menzionati all'interno di molti testi in sanscrito. Da oriente, gli elefanti migrarono fino all'Impero Persiano, dove affrontarono Alessandro Magno nella battaglia di Gaugamela; sebbene non giocarono un ruolo fondamentale in quello scontro, Alessandro comprese la loro utilità e cominciò a utilizzarli nel suo esercito. Più tardi, l'impiego degli elefanti si diffuse in Europa, dove vennero utilizzati nelle Guerre Macedoni e da Annibale, durante la Seconda Guerra Punica.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los elefantes son los mamíferos terrestres vivos más grandes. ¡Cuando nace, el peso de una cría de elefante suele rondar los cien kilos! En su entorno, exhiben un complejo comportamiento social y fuertes lazos familiares. La jerarquía social de los grupos cría-madre se basa en el tamaño y la edad, estando arriba los más grandes y viejos y abajo los más pequeños y jóvenes. Los machos adolescentes determinan su propia clasificación compitiendo en peleas con la cabeza y los colmillos. Los elefantes se comunican con tonos subsónicos muy bajos y de gran alcance.[PARAGRAPH:1]La doma de elefantes comenzó en el valle del Indo hace unos cuatro mil años. El primer uso militar que se hizo de ellos data del año 1100 a. C., y se menciona en varios himnos sánscritos. Desde el este, los elefantes de guerra migraron al imperio persa donde se enfrentaron a Alejandro Magno en la batalla de Gaugamela. Aunque no jugaron un papel significativo en la batalla, Alejandro vio su utilidad y los empezó a incorporar a su ejército. Más tarde, su uso se extendió por Europa y los elefantes se usaron en famosas contiendas, como las Guerras Macedónicas y en la segunda Guerra Púnica, por Aníbal.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Marble is a kind of limestone, used by man for millennia. It is a useful material for construction, especially in dry climates. Marble is an excellent material from which to make statues, as well. Marble surfaces can be polished to a beautiful sheen, but the rock remains attractive even when the surface is left rough.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Egyptians used marble blocks to line the outside of the Pyramid of Cheops. The Greeks used blocks of marble to construct some of their buildings; they also used the material to sculpt some of the world's great artworks. The Romans were the first to use slabs of marble as wall coverings. Marble remains one of the most popular construction and artistic materials extant.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le marbre est une roche dérivée du calcaire, utilisée par l'homme depuis des millénaires. C'est un matériau de construction très utile, notamment sous les climats secs. C'est aussi une matière très prisée pour la fabrication de statues. Souvent poli pour son lustre unique, le marbre est aussi utilisé sous sa forme brute.[PARAGRAPH:1]Les Egyptiens ont utilisé des blocs de marbre pour couvrir l'extérieur de la pyramide de Kheops. Les Grecs ont construit des bâtiments en blocs de marbre et ont aussi utilisé ce matériau pour créer certaines des sculptures les plus célèbres au monde. Les Romains ont été les premiers à utiliser des plaques de marbre pour couvrir leurs murs. Le marbre est aujourd'hui encore un matériau très prisé pour la construction et la sculpture.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Marmor ist eine Kalksteinart, die schon seit Jahrtausenden genutzt wird. Er eignet sich vor allem in trockenen Regionen als Baumaterial und für die Herstellung von Statuen. Marmoroberflächen können poliert werden, werden aber auch naturbelassen eingesetzt.[PARAGRAPH:1]Die Ägypter nutzten Marmorblöcke, um die Außenseite der Cheopspyramide zu verkleiden. Die Griechen konstruierten einige Gebäude aus Marmorblöcken und schufen aus diesem Material einige der schönsten Kunstwerke der Welt. Die Römer verwendeten erstmals Marmorplatten als Wandbedeckungen. Marmor gehört bis heute zu den beliebtesten Materialien für Bau- und Kunstwerke.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il marmo è una specie di sedimento calcareo, utilizzato dall'umanità per millenni. È un materiale utile per la costruzione, specialmente nei climi secchi. È anche fondamentale nella realizzazione di statue: le superfici marmoree possono essere levigate fino a diventare lucide, ma rimangono comunque affascinanti anche se lasciate grezze.[PARAGRAPH:1]Gli Egizi allineavano blocchi di marmo fuori dalla Piramide di Cheope. I Greci usavano blocchi di marmo per costruire i loro edifici e realizzare alcune delle grandi opere artistiche. I Romani sono stati i primi a usare lastre di marmo per il rivestimento delle pareti. Il marmo rimane tutt'oggi uno dei materiali più popolari per la realizzazione di costruzioni e di opere artistiche.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El mármol es una variedad de piedra caliza empleada por el hombre desde hace miles de años. Es un material útil para la construcción, especialmente en climas secos. También es excelente para construir estatuas. Las superficies de mármol se pueden pulir para conseguir un brillo precioso, pero la roca no deja de ser atractiva incluso si la superficie permanece rugosa.[PARAGRAPH:1]Los egipcios usaron bloques de mármol para recubrir el exterior de la pirámide de Keops. Los griegos los emplearon para construir algunos de sus edificios; también usaron este material para esculpir algunas de las mayores creaciones artísticas del mundo. Los romanos fueron los primeros en usar losas de mármol como revestimientos de paredes. El mármol sigue siendo hoy uno de los materiales más populares en la construcción y el arte.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Throughout history, man has been fascinated by moving images. Before the movie, such images were created by magic lanterns, zoetropes, flip books, and the like. In the 1880s, photographic film was invented, and the new material's potential to create moving pictures was quickly seen. Within just several years motion picture cameras and projectors were created, and the "movie" - moving pictures - was born.[PARAGRAPH:1]Movies were silent for their first forty years, but by the late 1920s soundtracks were added and the "talkie" was born. By the mid-1950s color film was common. Excepting for improvements in picture and sound quality, movies have remained essentially the same since.[PARAGRAPH:1]In the early years of movies, the United States produced the majority of films, most made in Hollywood, California. Though the US remains an important producer, a number of other countries now have film industries that rival Hollywood. For instance, the Indian film industry produces more films per year than the US and sells more tickets. However, no other films can yet match Hollywood's international appeal.
TEXT.French: [TAB]De tout temps, l'homme a été fasciné par les images animées. Avant l'invention du cinéma, ces images étaient obtenues grâce aux lanternes magiques, aux zootropes, aux folioscopes, ou autres. La pellicule photographique est inventée dans les années 1880, et très vite on réalise tout le potentiel de cette technologie pour produire des images animées. Les premières caméras et les premiers projecteurs de films animés font alors rapidement leur apparition. Le cinéma est né.[PARAGRAPH:1]Pendant 40 ans, le cinéma reste silencieux. Mais à la fin des années 1920, on ajoute des bandes sonores. Le cinéma parlant est né. Ensuite, les films colorisés se généralisent au cours des années 1950. Depuis, la forme du cinéma est restée sensiblement la même, si ce n'est que l'image et le son ont été améliorés.[PARAGRAPH:1]Aux débuts du cinéma, les Etats-Unis produisaient la majorité des films, essentiellement à Hollywood, en Californie. Bien que les Etats-Unis demeurent un important producteur de films, de nombreux pays possèdent une industrie du cinéma. Le cinéma indien, par exemple, produit plus de films et enregistre plus d'entrées dans les salles que le cinéma hollywoodien. Ce dernier conserve toutefois une place prédominante sur le marché mondial.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Menschen waren von bewegten Bildern schon immer fasziniert. Vor der Erfindung des Films wurden diese Bilder von magischen Laternen, Lebensrädern, Daumenkinos und ähnlichen Apparaturen erzeugt. Als in den 80er Jahren des 19. Jahrhunderts der fotografische Film erfunden wurde, erkannte man rasch das Potenzial des neuen Materials. Innerhalb weniger Jahre entstanden erste Filmkameras und -projektoren. Dies war die Geburtsstunde des modernen Films.[PARAGRAPH:1]40 Jahre später löste der Tonfilm den Stummfilm ab. Mitte der 50er Jahre des 20. Jahrhunderts entstanden die ersten Farbfilme. Abgesehen von der ständig verbesserten Bild- und Tonqualität hat sich der Film seitdem kaum verändert.[PARAGRAPH:1]Anfangs entstanden die meisten Filme in den berühmten Hollywood-Studios in Kalifornien. Obwohl die USA den internationalen Film auch heute noch prägen, haben sich in vielen anderen Ländern eigenständige Filmindustrien entwickelt. Die indische Filmindustrie produziert beispielsweise schon heute mehr Filme als die USA und verkauft deutlich mehr Kinokarten. Das internationale Renommee Hollywoods ist allerdings bis heute unerreicht.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'uomo è da sempre affascinato dalle immagini in movimento. Prima del cinema, queste immagini venivano create usando lanterne magiche, zoetrope, libri da scorrere velocemente e cose del genere. Nel 1880, venne inventata la pellicola fotografica e si capì subito le potenzialità di questo nuovo materiale per creare immagini in movimento. In pochi anni, vennero realizzate le prime cineprese e i primi proiettori; da lì a breve nacquero i primi "film" e il cinema.[PARAGRAPH:1]Per i primi quarant'anni, i film furono tutti muti, ma a partire dal 1920 vennero aggiunte delle colonne sonore e fu possibile inserire il "parlato". Da metà degli anni '50 in poi, i film a colori divennero molto diffusi. Se si escludono i miglioramenti nella qualità audio/video, i film sono rimasti essenzialmente gli stessi.[PARAGRAPH:1]Nei primi anni di vita dei film, gli Stati Uniti ne produssero la stragrande maggioranza, quasi tutti realizzati presso Hollywood, California. Malgrado gli USA rimangano produttori importanti di pellicole, nel corso degli anni altre nazioni hanno avviato industrie cinematografiche in grado di rivaleggiare con Hollywood. Per esempio, l'industria cinematografica Indiana produce annualmente un numero di pellicole superiore a quello degli Stati Uniti e vengono venduti più biglietti dei cinema. Tuttavia, poche nazioni possono rivaleggiare con il fascino internazionale delle pellicole hollywoodiane.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]A lo largo de la historia, al hombre le han fascinado las imágenes en movimiento. Antes del cine, tales imágenes se creaban mediante proyectores, zootropos, páginas en movimiento y similares. En la década de 1880 se inventó la película fotográfica y rápidamente se vio el potencial de aquel material para crear imágenes en movimiento. En solo unos años se crearon cámaras y proyectores de imágenes en movimiento, naciendo así el "cine" (del griego "kinos", movimiento).[PARAGRAPH:1]Las películas fueron mudas durante sus primeros cuarenta años de historia, pero a finales de los años 20, se añadieron bandas sonoras y apareció la película con sonido. Para mediados de los 50, el cine en color era algo normal. Excepto por las mejoras en la calidad de la imagen y del sonido, las películas han permanecido esencialmente iguales desde entonces.[PARAGRAPH:1]En los primeros años del cine, EE. UU. produjo la mayor parte de ellas, la mayoría hechas en Hollywood, California. Aunque sigue siendo un productor importante, otros muchos países tienen ahora industrias cinematográficas que rivalizan con Hollywood. Por ejemplo, la industria india del cine produce más películas al año que los EE. UU., y vende más entradas. Sin embargo, ningún filme rivaliza todavía con el atractivo internacional de las películas de Hollywood.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Music is an art form that involves audible sound. The sound may be created by human voices, percussion, by hitting or strumming strings under tension, by blowing air across a reed, and so forth. It is impossible to date the origins of music, but instruments made of stone and bone have been discovered dating back more than 45,000 years. Every culture known has developed its own forms of music.[PARAGRAPH:1]It is impossible to imagine what the earliest forms of music sounded like. It was impossible to record any kind of music until the invention of musical notation. It is believed that ancient Egypt had some form of musical notation dating to 3000 BC, while the Greeks were notating music in 200 BC. The current western style of musical notation is credited to Guido d'Arezzo around 1020 AD.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La musique est une forme d'art impliquant des sons perceptibles. Le son peut provenir de voix humaines, d'instruments à percussions, d'instrument à cordes que l'on gratte ou pince, d'instruments à vent dans lesquels on souffle, etc. Il est impossible de dater l'origine de la musique, mais des instruments en pierre et en os, vieux de plus 45 000 ans, ont été découverts. Toutes les civilisations connues ont développé leurs propres formes de musique.[PARAGRAPH:1]Il est impossible de savoir à quoi ressemblaient les premières formes de musique. En effet, la musique n'a pu être consignée par écrit qu'à partir de l'invention de notations musicales. On pense qu'il existait une forme de notation musicale dans l'ancienne Egypte, datant d'environ 3 000 ans av. J.-C. Les Grecs mettaient la musique par écrit en 200 av. J.-C. La forme de notation musicale occidentale actuelle aurait été inventée par Guido d'Arezzo en 1020 ap. J.-C.
TEXT.German: [TAB]In der Musik werden durch menschliche Stimmen oder Musikinstrumente harmonische Töne und Klänge erzeugt. Wichtige Instrumentgruppen sind Blas-, Streich- und Zupfinstrumente. Es ist unmöglich, die Entstehungszeit der Musik exakt zu datieren. Die ältesten gefundenen Instrumente aus Stein und Knochen sind allerdings über 45.000 Jahre alt. Jede Kultur hat ihre typische Musik.[PARAGRAPH:1]Über die Klangbilder früher Musikformen ist nur wenig bekannt, da es bis zur Erfindung der Notenschrift unmöglich war, die Musik aufzuzeichnen. Vermutlich gab es im antiken Ägypten bereits um 3000 vor Christus eine Art Notenschrift. In Griechenland entstand die erste Notenschrift erst knapp 1000 Jahre später. Die moderne westliche Notenschrift entstand um 1020 nach Christus und geht auf Guido d'Arezzo zurück.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La musica è una forma d'arte che riguarda il suono generato da voci umane, percussioni, dai colpi su corde tese, soffiando attraverso delle canne e via dicendo. È impossibile stabilire con esattezza il periodo di nascita della musica, ma sono stati ritrovati strumenti di pietra che potrebbero risalire addirittura a 45.000 anni fa. Ciascuna cultura conobbe e sviluppò un determinato tipo di musica.[PARAGRAPH:1]È impossibile cercare di immaginare quali fossero le melodie preistoriche, poiché non fu possibile trascrivere la musica senza un sistema di note. Si crede che la prima stesura di note musicali possa essere attribuita agli Egizi attorno al 3000 a. C., mentre i Greci cominciarono a trascrivere musica a partire dal 200 a. C. L'attuale sistema occidentale di trascrizione delle note musicali risale all'incirca al 1020 d. C. ed è attribuito a Guido D'Arezzo.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La música es una forma de arte en la que interviene el sonido audible. Este sonido puede provenir de voces humanas, percusión, toque de cuerdas tensadas, soplo de aire a través de una caña, etc. Es imposible poner fecha a su origen, pero se han descubierto instrumentos de piedra y hueso que tienen más de 45.000 años. Todas las culturas conocidas han desarrollado su propia forma de música.[PARAGRAPH:1]Es imposible imaginar cómo sonaban las formas de música primitivas. Hasta la invención de las notas musicales fue imposible registrar ningún tipo de música. Se cree que en el antiguo Egipto existía una especie de notación musical que se remonta al año 3.000 a. C., mientras que los griegos pusieron notas a su música en el 200 a. C. El estilo occidental actual de notación musical se debe a Guido d'Arezzo, aproximadamente en el año 1020.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Pandyas of Southern India are believed to have been founded around 400 BC. They controlled the pearl fisheries along the South Indian coast, between Sri Lanka and India-Gulf of Mannar Gulf of Mannar, which produced some of the finest pearls in the known ancient world. The Gulf of Mannar is known for its pearl banks of Pinctada radiata and Pinctada fucata for at least two thousand years. Megasthenes reported about the pearl fisheries of the Pandyas, indicating that the Pandyas derived great wealth from the pearl trade.[PARAGRAPH:1]For thousands of years, most seawater pearls were retrieved by divers working in the Indian Ocean, in areas like the Persian Gulf, the Red Sea, and in the Gulf of Mannar. Starting in the Han Dynasty (206 BC-220 AD), the Chinese hunted extensively for seawater pearls in the South China Sea. In the 14th-century Arabian Sea, the traveller Ibn Battuta provided the earliest known description of pearl diving by means of attaching a cord to the diver's waist. [PARGRAPH:1]When Spanish conquistadors arrived in the Western Hemisphere, they discovered that around the islands of Cubagua and Margarita, some 200 km north of the Venezuelan coast, was an extensive pearl bed (a bed of pearl oysters).[PARAGRAPH:1]Margarita pearls are extremely difficult to find today and are known for their unique yellowish color. The most famous Margarita necklace that any one can see today is the one that then Venezuelan President Romulo Betancourt gave to Jacqueline Kennedy when she and her husband, President John F. Kennedy paid an official visit to Venezuela.[PARAGRAPH:1]Before the beginning of the 20th century, pearl hunting was the most common way of harvesting pearls. Divers manually pulled oysters from ocean floors and river bottoms and checked them individually for pearls. Not all mussels and oysters produce pearls. In a haul of three tons, only three or four oysters will produce perfect pearls.

[TAB]Silver is a chemical element in the periodic table that has the symbol "Ag" and the atomic number 47. A soft, white, lustrous transition metal, silver has the highest electrical and thermal conductivity of any metal and is found in mineral deposits and in free form.[PARAGRAPH:1]Slag heaps found in Asia Minor indicate that silver has been known about for a long time, and that it was being separated from lead as early as the fourth millennium BC.
TEXT.French: [TAB]L'argent est un élément chimique qui apparaît dans le tableau périodique sous le symbole "Ag" et le numéro atomique 47. C'est un métal de transition malléable, blanc et brillant. C'est aussi le métal qui a la plus forte conductivité électrique et thermique. On le trouve dans des gisements miniers ou sous forme libre.[PARAGRAPH:1]La découverte de terrils en Asie Mineure indique que l'argent est connu de longue date, et qu'on le sépare du plomb depuis 6 000 ans.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Silber ist ein chemisches Element des Periodensystems. Es hat das Symbol "Ag" und die Ordnungszahl 47. Das weiche und glänzende Metall hat die beste elektrische und thermale Leitfähigkeit aller Metalle. Silber kommt in Mineralverbindungen und in reiner Form vor.[PARAGRAPH:1]In Kleinasien entdeckte Aschereste lassen vermuten, dass Silber schon sehr lange bekannt ist und bereits im vierten Jahrtausend vor Christus von Blei getrennt wurde.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'argento è un elemento chimico della tavola periodica, dal simbolo "Ag" e dal numero atomico 47. L'argento è un metallo malleabile, bianco e lucente: è il miglior termo-elettro conduttore. Può essere trovato in giacimenti e in forma libera.[PARAGRAPH:1]Cumuli di scorie trovati in Asia Minore indicano che l'argento era conosciuto da tempo e che veniva separato dal piombo già nel quarto millennio a. C.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La plata es un elemento químico de la tabla periódica que tiene el símbolo "Ag" y el número atómico 47. Un metal de transición blando, blanco y lustroso, tiene la conductividad térmica y eléctrica más alta de todos los metales, y se encuentra en depósitos minerales y en estado puro.[PARAGRAPH:1]Las acumulaciones de escoria encontradas en Asia Menor indican que la plata se conoce desde hace mucho tiempo, y que ya se separaba del plomo en el año 4000 a. C.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Stone has always been and remains one of the most important human building materials. In fact, stone tools predate human history. It appears as if the first stone tools were used by Paranthropus, an ancestor of man who lived about two million years ago.[PARAGRAPH:1]Most stone tools are created by chipping or grinding. The former is used when working with crystalline materials such as flint, chert and obsidian. The worker taps the stone with a harder stone, carefully chipping off stone flakes until the stone has been properly shaped. Mesoamerican tribes used this method to make their sharp and deadly obsidian swords.[PARAGRAPH:1]The grinding method is used when working with harder and coarser materials such as basalt and granite. This is a long and tedious process in which the toolmaker repeatedly grinds away the stone with a harder material or with sand, sometimes using water as a lubricant. Many of the earliest European stone axes were made using this process.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La pierre est depuis toujours le matériau de construction le plus répandu. L'apparition des outils en pierre marque même l'avènement de l'homme. C'est semble-t-il le Paranthropus, un ancêtre de l'homme qui vivait il y a deux millions d'années, qui fut le premier à utiliser des outils en pierre.[PARAGRAPH:1]La plupart des outils en pierre sont fabriqués en taillant ou en polissant la pierre. La première technique est utilisée avec les matériaux cristallins tels que le silex, le chert ou l'obsidienne. Elle consiste à frapper la pierre avec une pierre plus dure pour la tailler progressivement en enlevant des éclats. Les tribus d'Amérique centrale utilisaient cette méthode pour fabriquer leurs épées d'obsidienne.[PARAGRAPH:1]La méthode du polissage est utilisée avec les pierres plus dures, comme le basalte ou le granit. C'est un processus long et laborieux qui consiste à frotter de manière répétée la pierre avec un matériau plus dur ou avec du sable, en l'arrosant parfois pour la lubrifier. Les premières haches de pierre fabriquées en Europe sont nées de ce procédé.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Stein war, ist und bleibt das wichtigste Baumaterial der Menschen. Schon lange vor dem Beginn der Geschichtsschreibung hat es Steinwerkzeuge gegeben. Vermutlich wurden die ersten Steinwerkzeuge vom Paranthropus, einem Urahnen der Menschen, vor etwa zwei Millionen Jahren eingesetzt.[PARAGRAPH:1]Die meisten Steinwerkzeuge werden durch Abschlagen oder Schleifen geschaffen. Erstere Methode wird vor allem bei der Arbeit mit kristallinen Materialien wie Flint, Feuerstein und Obsidian eingesetzt. Der Arbeiter schlägt mit einem härteren Stein auf den Stein, bis dieser die gewünschte Form hat. Mesoamerikanische Stämme nutzten diese Methode, um ihre scharfen und tödlichen Obsidianschwerter herzustellen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Die Schleifmethode wird bei der Arbeit mit härteren Materialien, wie Basalt und Granit, eingesetzt. Bei diesem langen und ermüdenden Prozess schleift der Werkzeugmacher den Stein immer wieder mit einem härteren Material oder mit Sand ab. Manchmal wird dazu auch Wasser als Schmiermittel eingesetzt. Viele der frühen europäischen Steinäxte sind auf diese Art und Weise entstanden.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La pietra è da sempre il materiale più importante nelle opere di costruzione dell'uomo. Infatti, i primi oggetti in pietra risalgono agli albori della storia dell'umanità. Pare che fu addirittura il Paronthropus, un antenato dell'uomo vissuto due milioni di anni fa, a utilizzare i primi strumenti realizzati in pietra.[PARAGRAPH:1]La maggior parte degli oggetti in pietra veniva creata scheggiando e affilando: l'artigiano colpiva una pietra con un'altra pietra più dura, cercando di rimuovere piccole scaglie, fino a ottenere la forma desiderata. Le tribù mesoamericane usavano questo metodo per realizzare le loro letali e affilate spade di ossidiana.[PARAGRAPH:1]Il metodo di affilamento veniva utilizzato per lavorare materiali più ruvidi e grezzi, come il basalto e il granito; questo processo era lungo e ripetitivo per l'artigiano, che doveva affilare la pietra con materiale più duro o con sabbia, utilizzando acqua come lubrificante. Molte delle prime asce di pietra europee vennero realizzate con questo procedimento.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La piedra ha sido y sigue siendo uno de los materiales más importantes de construcción de la humanidad. De hecho, las herramientas de piedra pertenecen a la Prehistoria. Parece ser que las primeras fueron empleadas por el parantropus, un antepasado del hombre que vivió hace unos dos millones de años.[PARAGRAPH:1]La mayoría de las herramientas de piedra se creaban a base de cincelar o amolar. La primera técnica se usaba al trabajar materiales cristalinos como el sílex, el pedernal y la obsidiana. El fabricante golpeaba la piedra con otra más dura, separando cuidadosamente escamas de piedra hasta que la herramienta tenía la forma adecuada. Las tribus centroamericanas empleaban este método para fabricar sus afiladas y mortíferas espadas de obsidiana.[PARAGRAPH:1]El método de amolar se empleaba al trabajar con materiales más duros y toscos como el basalto y el granito. Es un proceso largo y tedioso en el que el fabricante desbasta repetidamente la piedra con un material más duro o con arena, empleando a menudo agua como lubricante. Muchas de las primeras hachas de piedra europeas se crearon mediante este proceso.

TEXT.English: [TAB]It is believed that tobacco began growing in the Americas about 6,000 BC, and by 1 BC Native Americans were using tobacco in spiritual rituals and social gatherings. On October 15, 1492 Columbus was presented with a gift of dried tobacco leaves by the Native Americans. Soon after, it was brought to Europe where its popularity soared as people thought it cured everything from bad breath to cancer. The opposite, of course, was true. In 1847 Phillip Morris established selling hand rolled Turkish cigarettes. Cigarettes have served in every war since WW I, and have become entwined with images of war in the modern era. The active ingredient, Nicotine, is a highly toxic liquid alkaloid which has since been recognized as severely detrimental to health. The neuro-depressant is highly addictive, and also suppresses appetite while increasing blood pressure. New users experience a "high," while experienced users feel simple satisfaction.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Certains types de plantes ont évolué de telle manière qu'elles produisent des toxines rendant leur odeur ou leur saveur insupportable pour les animaux. Curieusement, ces odeurs et ces saveurs ont incité l'homme à rechercher ces plantes. Les marchands du Moyen-Orient ont cré vers 2000 av. J.-C. un marché des épices extrêmement lucratif. Les épices sont utilisées aujourd'hui, comme par le passé, pour conserver la nourriture et rehausser le goût des mets. Bien que de nos jours les épices soient cultivées et préparées à échelle commerciale, la plupart peuvent encore être trouvées en grande quantité dans la nature. Certaines des épices les plus recherchées, comme la muscade ou le clou de girofle, sont extraites de plantes qui poussent dans les régions tropicales ou marécageuses.
